weapon.title: Alhulak
weapon.description: This weapon is an unusual flail. A short length of rope separates a four-bladed, hafted grappling hook from the handle.

weapon.title: Bastard sword
weapon.description: This heavier variation of the longsword requires special training to cope with its weight and peculiar balance. Warriors who master the bastard sword gain the typical sword accuracy combined with the striking power of a warhammer or battle axe.

weapon.title: Blowgun
weapon.description: This long, tubular weapon is used by blowing on one end. It can launch darts and other agents.

weapon.title: Bola
weapon.description: Consisting of two or three weighte spheres connected by a cord, bolas tangle up opponents, but the spheres are also strong enough to inflict injuries.

weapon.title: Boomerang
weapon.description: Simple curved, polished sticks, a boomerang automatically returns to a proficient wielder's hand after a ranged attack with the weapon is resolved.
These weapons are common among the halfling tribes of the Talenta Plains in the world of Eberron.

weapon.title: Broadsword
weapon.description: Compared to a longsword, a broadsword has a heavier blade more suited to brutal tactics than to quick maneuvers.

weapon.title: Cahulaks
weapon.description: This double weapon features two four-bladed, hafted heads separated by a length of rope. The secondary end is light enough to be used as an off-hand weapon.
When one end of this weapon is held by the haft, the rope is long enough to grant the other end reach.
The entire weapon can be thrown.

weapon.title: Carrikal
weapon.description: This axe has two forward-facing blades.

weapon.title: Chatkcha
weapon.description: This throwing wedge is a thri-kreen invention. It returns to a proficient wielder's hand after the ranged attack is resolved.

weapon.title: Club
weapon.description: A simple wooden club that gets the job done.

weapon.title: Craghammer
weapon.description: This deadly dwarven hammer has a heavily weighted head, making it resemble a one-handed maul backed by a deadly spike.

weapon.title: Crossbow
weapon.description: Essentially a small metal bow mounted on a stock and equipped with a mechanical trigger.

weapon.title: Cutting Wheel
weapon.description: The cutting wheel is a bladed disk with a guarded handle at one side. Many wheels feature spikes or barbs to protect the wielder's hand.

weapon.title: Dagger
weapon.description: A small blade, great for stabbing, cutting and throwing.

weapon.title: Dejada
weapon.description: A long, scooped basket fitted with a glovelike bracer, the dejada is used to hurl projectiles. Ammunition can be a fist-sized stone, but the weapon is also used to extend the range of explosive alchemical mixtures.

weapon.title: Double Axe
weapon.description: Fitted with an axe at each end, a double axe offers increases offensive and defensive capabilities.

weapon.title: Double Flail
weapon.description: This weapon has a spiked flail head at either end to maximize attack and damage.

weapon.title: Double scimitar
weapon.description: The double scimitar features a curving blade extending out from each side of its handle.

weapon.title: Double Sword
weapon.description: This well-balanced weapon combines the deadliness of two longswords with increases defensive capability.

weapon.title: Dragon Paw
weapon.description: Short blades attach to either end of this staff. In the center of this double weapon is a guard with a protruding blade perpendicular to the staff.
The light, middle blade (which serves as the secondary end) can be used for quick jabs, ideal for a warrior with a roguish bent.

weapon.title: Drow Long Knife
weapon.description: This blade is three-quarters the length of a longsword, and ends in an outwardly curving hook. Too slender to be considered a short sword and too big for a dagger, it is know as a long knife.

weapon.title: Execution Axe
weapon.description: This broad-bladed axe is heavily weighted for greater hewing power.

weapon.title: Falchion
weapon.description: A falchion features a long, wide blade that bends in a curve, similar to that of a scimitar.

weapon.title: Flail
weapon.description: Based on a simple agricultural tool, a flail is a wooden handle attached by a short chain to a spiked metal ball. The chain allows a skilled warrior to generate impressive force with each stroke or entangle a foe's legs or arms.

weapon.title: Fullblade
weapon.description: This enormous, two-handed sword is favored by some fighters and paladins.

weapon.title: Garrote
weapon.description: This strangling tool is a length of wire or knotted rope with handles on either end.
The only attacks you can make with a garrote are ones that require or allow its use.

Also, if you are holding a garrote in both hands, you can use the grab action without having a hand free. If the attack hits, the target takes 1[W] damage from the garrote. This increases to 2[W] at 21st level.

weapon.title: Gauntlet Axe
weapon.description: This heavy bracer holds two light crescent blades, turning the forearm into an axe while keeping the hand free.
A character that has proficiency with light shields can choose to use a gauntlet axe as one.
A gauntlet axe can be enchanted as either an arms slot item or as a magic weapon. When enchanted as a magic weapon, it does not occupy a character's arms slot.

weapon.title: Glaive
weapon.description: With its long haft that ends in a sword-like cutting blade, the glaive excels at keeping enemies at at distance.

weapon.title: Gouge
weapon.description: This spade-like weapon has a long haft with a handle on the end. The head is a wide, double-edged blade with a stabbing point at the top. Some gouges are fitted with a strap or a harness, making the weapon easier to carry.

weapon.title: Greataxe
weapon.description: A two-handed axe designed for battle, a greataxe has one or two blades.

weapon.title: Greatbow
weapon.description: This massive, recurved bow stands as tall as as a human when strung, and fires arrows with greater power than a traditional longbow.

weapon.title: Greatclub
weapon.description: This larger, bulkier version of the common club is heavy enough that you can’t wield it with one hand.

weapon.title: Greatspear
weapon.description: This reach weapon resembles a longspear, but its broad head and strong haft allow it to strike with increases force.

weapon.title: Greatsword
weapon.description: An large, two-handed sword. Some of them have a dulled lower blade that can be gripped.

weapon.title: Gythka
weapon.description: Each end of this thri-kreen staff has a small, crescent-shaped blade with a centered stabbing tine.
A gythka can be thrown like a javeling.

weapon.title: Halberd
weapon.description: A halberd's heavy head makes it a devastating weapon, while its long haft grants it the reach needed to deter would-be attackers.
On the desert world of Athas, a halberd is known as a trikal and it has three blades symmetrically length-wise from its haft.

weapon.title: Hand Crossbow
weapon.description: This crossbow is small enough to be aimed with just one hand, though you still need another hand free to load it.

weapon.title: Handaxe
weapon.description: A simple axe for hacking and hurling.

weapon.title: Heavy Flail
weapon.description: This two-handed variation of a standard flail can bash through armor with ease

weapon.title: Heavy War Pick
weapon.description: A longer haft and a heavier pick end make this weapon an ideal choice for a gnome or a halfling in search of a two-handed weapon

weapon.title: Javelin
weapon.description: A simple spear that has been balanced for throwing.

weapon.title: Katar
weapon.description: Also known as a punching dagger, this blade has an H-shaped handle that its wielder grasps in his or her fist. By driving this weapon at a foe with a punching motion, the katar's wielder strikes with deep and deadly attacks.
On the desert world of Athas, the katar is known as a puchik, and it the handle is perpendicular to the blade.
A Rogue proficient with the katar can treat it as a dagger for the purposes of the Scoundrel Weapon Talent class feature.

weapon.title: Khopesh
weapon.description: This sturdy weapon is identified by the crescent-shaped curve at the end of its blade.

weapon.title: Kukri
weapon.description: The blade of this heavy knife curves forward for greater potency.
A Rogue proficient with the kukri can treat it as a dagger for the purposes of the Scoundrel Weapon Talent class feature.

weapon.title: Kusari-gama
weapon.description: Originally a tool used by farmers and peasants to tend crops and for a variety of other mundane uses, the kusari-gama was adopted as a weapon because of both its flexibility and its ability to pass unnoticed as a common item.
This weapon features a sickle (or kama) on one end of a chain and a heavy weight on the other, with the weight swung with great force.

weapon.title: Lance
weapon.description: This long, heavy spear relies on the weight and speed of a charging mount to skewer a hapless enemy.
Most mounted warriors set aside their lances once they engage in close quarters fighting.

weapon.title: Light Mace
weapon.description: The smaller races often prefer this version of the mace because of its lighter weight. It can deliver a solid, if not crushing, blow to an enemy.

weapon.title: Light War Pick
weapon.description: This variation on the pick trades hitting power for speed and agility.
Gnomes often favor the light war pick as an off-hand weapon.

weapon.title: Longbow
weapon.description: A longbow is made up of one solid piece of carefully curved wood, and able to launch arrows over long distances.

weapon.title: Longspear
weapon.description: This very long spear, sometimes called a pike, is purely for thrusting rather than throwing, and is used by many soldiers and city watch for crowd control.

weapon.title: Longsword
weapon.description: Longswords are one-edged or two-edged swords with heavy blades that can be wielded in one hand.

weapon.title: Lotulis
weapon.description: This short-staffed double weapon sports outward-pointing, barbed crescent blades on each end.

weapon.title: Mace
weapon.description: With a stout haft and a heavy metal head, a mace is sturdy and allows its wielder to deliver powerful blows.

weapon.title: Maul
weapon.description: Simply put, mauls are just massive warhammers.

weapon.title: Mordenkrad
weapon.description: First used by drawf shock troops in battle against giants, this oversized two-handed hammer has a massive head studded with spikes.

weapon.title: Morningstar
weapon.description: This fancier take on a two-handed club consists of a wooden haft topped with a spiked metal ball. It is common among those that want a heavy weapon that requires little training or maintenance.

weapon.title: Net
weapon.description: This net consists of a web of rope or cord fitted with heavy weights. A trailing cord enables the wielder to recall the net or to control entangled opponents.

weapon.title: Parrying Dagger
weapon.description: This narrow dagger features a specially designed guard that can deflect attacks.
A Rogue proficient with the punching dagger can treat it as a dagger for the purposes of the Scoundrel Weapon Talent class feature.

weapon.title: Quarterstaff
weapon.description: This reinforced, long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

weapon.title: Rapier
weapon.description: The weapon of choice for a sophisticated duelist, the rapier is a long, light blade ideal for parrying blows and delivering quick counterattacks.

weapon.title: Repeating Crossbow
weapon.description: A rectangular magazine attaches to the top of this crossbow. A double-action lever drops a bolt into place, allowing the crossbow to be reloaded as a free action as long as there is ammunition in the magazine.
A magazine holds 10 bolts. It takes a standard action to remove an empty magazine and load a new one.

weapon.title: Scimitar
weapon.description: This one-handed sword has a curved blade that broadens toward the point.

weapon.title: Scourge
weapon.description: This lightweight flail has leather thongs inlaid with sharpened bits of metal.

weapon.title: Scythe
weapon.description: Derived from a farming tool used to mow down long grains and cereals, this weapon has a long wooden shaft with protruding handles, capped with a curved blade set at a right angle.

weapon.title: Serrated Pick
weapon.description: This weapon is similar to a standard pick, except for its longer, sharper, and saw-like pick head. With proper training, a warrior can inflict terrible wounds with this weapon.

weapon.title: Short Spear
weapon.description: Although this weapon often serves the same role as a spear, it is more handy and can also be used as a thrown weapon.

weapon.title: Short sword
weapon.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, and are often used as a sidearm.

weapon.title: Shortbow
weapon.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

weapon.title: Shuriken
weapon.description: This weapon covers throwing stars, light throwing knives, and other small bladed weapons.

weapon.title: Sickle
weapon.description: Originally a farming tool used for reaping grain, this one-handed weapon has a short wooden handle ending in a curved blade.

weapon.title: Singing Stick
weapon.description: The ends of this narrow rod are carved to be slightly wider than the middle. It whistles as it spins in the hands of a proficient user.

weapon.title: Sling
weapon.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

weapon.title: Spear
weapon.description: A long shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed or two-handed.

weapon.title: Spiked Chain
weapon.description: Eladrin duelists are thought to be the first to employ this weapon, and its combination of speed and elegance supports that theory.

weapon.title: Spiked Gauntlet
weapon.description: These gauntlets are specially fitted with metal spikes.
On the desert world of Athas, a spiked gauntlet is called a talid, and is made from leather, chitin and bone.
A spiked gauntlet can be enchanted as either a hands slot item or as a magic weapon. When enchanted as a magic weapon, it does not occupy a character's hands slot.

weapon.title: Spiked Shield
weapon.description: This light shield is constructed with a sharpened spike at its center.
On the desert world or Athas, a spiked shield is known as a tortoise blade and is a bony or chitinous place with the blade pointing forward.
A spiked shield can be enchanted as either a magic shield (an arms slot item) or as a magic weapon. When enchanted as a magic weapon, it does not occupy a character's arms slot.

weapon.title: Superior Crossbow
weapon.description: This crossbow appears similar to a traditional crossbow, but it has knobs and dials that allow the weapon to be fine-tuned for greater accuracy.

weapon.title: Talenta Sharrash
weapon.description: A weapon from the Talenta Plains on the world of Eberron, the sharrash features a sickle-like blade at the end of a pole.

weapon.title: Talenta Tangat
weapon.description: Another weapon from the Talenta Plains on the world of Eberron, this curved sword is mounted on a short haft.

weapon.title: Throwing Hammer
weapon.description: This small hammer has been balanced so that it is easy to throw.

weapon.title: Tratnyr
weapon.description: Also known as a wingspear, this weapon was first crafted by the dragonborn for maximum efficiency in melee and ranged combat.
A character proficient with the spear simple weapon but not the tratnyr can choose to treat the tratnyr as a spear when wielding it.

weapon.title: Trident
weapon.description: This three-tined spear is weighted for throwing over short distances.

weapon.title: Triple-headed Flail
weapon.description: This oversized flail has three heads for more potent attacks.

weapon.title: Urgosh
weapon.description: Originally of dwarven make, this weapon has a heavy axe head at one end, and a sharp spear point at the base of the haft.

weapon.title: War Pick
weapon.description: Adapted from the common mining tool, a war pick features a compact design combined with a single, sharp point to punch through armor.
Gnomes and halflings favor war picks because of the weapon's small size.

weapon.title: Waraxe
weapon.description: This is a favorite weapon of dwarves, who can wield it with a shield or with two hands for greater damage. Either way, it cuts through orcs' necks very well.

weapon.title: Warhammer
weapon.description: This one-handed hammer has a heavy head on top of a sturdy haft.

weapon.title: Whip
weapon.description: Stories of novices injuring themselves with this weapon underscore the the difficulty of mastering the whip.

weapon.title: Unarmed Strike
weapon.description: When you punch, kick, elbow, knee, or even head butt an opponent, you're making an unarmed strike.

weapon.title: Small item
weapon.description: Anything you might pick up, like a rock or a stool.

weapon.title: Large item
weapon.description: Anything heavy you might hold with both hands, such as a large rocks or a chair.

weapon.title: Small thrown item
weapon.description: Anything you might pick up and throw, like a rock.
